description: From Ancient Greek πλεῦσις (pleûsis, “sailing”), from πλέω (pléō).

entries.meaning: (ecology) The organisms that live floating at the surface of water.
examples: They[Cnidarians] are also the dominant organisms of the marine pleuston, providing food or substrate for a variety of other invertebrates living at the air-water interface […] .

entries.meaning: (botany) Plants that live floating at the surface of water.
